poem:
A Modern Serenade  

the whisper of heat  
lifts dampness—  
an ordinary morning,  
years of gravity shed  
in the breath of  
a refined engine  

arms ache no longer  
as a light hum  
drifts over strands—  

release the clunky past;  
unfurl to the swift  
soft hand of  
convenience.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The best hair dryers for smooth, speedy styling at home – whatever your hair type In my years of reviewing beauty tech, it was upgrading my hair dryer that made the biggest difference to my beauty routine. I used to dread hair-wash days: the chore of shampooing, conditioning and rinsing my hair, plus the time – and aching arms – spent getting it dry again. My clunky, bargain-bucket hair dryer of seven years was weighty,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
